snippet: A study finds that spending on programs including food stamps, Medicaid and unemployment benefits increased by 18 percent between 2007 and 2010 as families slipped down the income ladder.
abstract: A study finds that spending on programs including food stamps, Medicaid and unemployment benefits increased by 18 percent between 2007 and 2010 as families slipped down the income ladder.

headline.main: How the Safety Net Held Up in the Recession
